name: Peach leaf curl
summary: Peach leaf curl is a fungal disease affecting peach trees, characterized by distorted and discolored leaves.

cause_of_disease.describe: The disease is caused by the fungus Taphrina deformans, which infects the leaf tissue.
Frequent rain and wet conditions during the leaf development phase contribute to the spread of the fungus.
Areas with poor air flow around the trees can lead to higher humidity and increased risk of infection.

steps: Apply a copper-based fungicide during the dormant season before bud swell.
Repeat application if necessary, according to product instructions, especially after a wet winter.
Regularly inspect trees and remove infected leaves to reduce spread.
Dispose of the infected leaves away from the tree to prevent contamination.
Prune trees properly to allow good air circulation among the branches.
Ensure the area around the tree is free from debris that can harbor fungal spores.

tips: Plant resistant peach varieties to reduce susceptibility to the disease.
Monitor weather conditions and adjust care accordingly to minimize disease risk.
Ensure proper watering and avoid wetting foliage to limit moisture levels.
